message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public class LazySequence<T> implements Iterator<T> {
    private Function<T, T> function;
    private T current;

    public LazySequence(T seed, Function<T, T> function) {
        this.current = seed;
        this.function = function;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return true;
    }

    @Override
    public T next() {
        T result = current;
        current = function.apply(current);
        return result;
    }

    public LazySequence<T> map(Function<T, T> newFunction) {
        return new LazySequence<>(current, newFunction.compose(function));
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we define a class `LazySequence` that implements `Iterator`. It has a `next` method that applies the function to the current value and updates the current value. The `map` method returns a new `LazySequence` with the same current value but a new function that is the composition of the old function and the new function. This allows for function composition and lazy evaluation.
